definitions.definition: The act of defining an object (usually a function) in terms of that object itself.
examples: n! = n × (n − 1)! (for n > 0) or 1 (for n = 0) defines the factorial function using recursion .

definitions.definition: The invocation of a procedure from within itself.
examples: This function uses recursion to compute factorials.

secondary_definitions: ( mathematics ) The act of defining an object (usually a function) in terms of that object itself.
( programming ) The invocation of a procedure from within itself.
